Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
chemist
(Cambridge) Someone who wastes computer time on {number crunching} when you'd far rather the computer were doing something more productive, such as working out anagrams of your name or printing Snoopy calendars or running {life} patterns. May or may not refer to someone who actually studies chemistry.
[{Jargon File}]
(1995-02-07)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chemist \Chem"ist\, n. [Shortened from alchemist; cf. F. chimiste.] A person versed in chemistry or given to chemical investigation; an analyst; a maker or seller of chemicals or drugs. [1913 Webster]

chemist n. [Cambridge] Someone who wastes computer time on {number-crunching} when you'd far rather the machine were doing something more productive, such as working out anagrams of your name or printing Snoopy calendars or running {life} patterns. May or may not refer to someone who actually studies chemistry.

chemist n 1: a scientist who specializes in chemistry 2: a health professional trained in the art of preparing and dispensing drugs [syn: {pharmacist}, {druggist}, {apothecary}, {pill pusher}, {pill roller}]
